channel.title: [Python]Md5Reversal
channel.description:
[code=python]## Cowie's MD5 Hash reversal import sys import md5 from time import sleep
class Main(object): def loadList(self): try: Words = open(Wordlist, "r").readlines() except(IOError): print "Please check your wordlist path\n" sys.exit(1) global Words
def waiting(self): print "Fetching output..." sleep(2) print "..." sleep(2) print "..." sleep(2)
def removeMD5(self, NoMD5): Output = "" for Hashed in Words: Hash = md5.new(Hashed.replace("\n","")).hexdigest() if NoMD5 == Hash: output = Hashed.replace("\n","") print self.waiting() print "\n" + output + "\n" print "Thank you for using Md5Reversal" sys.exit(1) else: print "It is pretty apparent that I cannot find the Md5 in the supplied wordlist, sorry." sys.exit(1)
## Specify wordlist below, include extension please Wordlist = "Wordlist.txt" ## Thank you! M = Main() M.loadList() ## Note: You can just enter a string directly into the M.removeMD5, remove the line below and just use M.removeMD5("<Md5Hash>"). toRem = raw_input("Please enter the Md5 you wish to reverse: ") ## Note: You can just enter a string directly into the M.removeMD5, remove the line below and just use M.removeMD5("<Md5Hash>"). M.removeMD5(toRem)[/code]
Basically, for the people who cannot be arsed reading it through, what it does it searches through a wordlist you specify, when it matches a word from it with the cracked MD5 it returns a result.

item.title: [Python]Md5Reversal
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[code=python]## Cowie’s MD5 Hash reversal
import sys
import md5
from time import sleep

class Main(object):
def loadList(self):
try:
Words = open(Wordlist, “r”).readlines()
except(IOError):
print “Please check your wordlist path\n”
sys.exit(1)
global Words

def waiting(self):
    print "Fetching output..."
    sleep(2)
    print "..."
    sleep(2)
    print "..."
    sleep(2)

def removeMD5(self, NoMD5):
    Output = ""
    for Hashed in Words:
        Hash = md5.new(Hashed.replace("\n","")).hexdigest()
        if NoMD5 == Hash: 
            output = Hashed.replace("\n","")
            print self.waiting()             
            print "\n" + output + "\n"
            print "Thank you for using Md5Reversal"
            sys.exit(1)
        else:
            print "It is pretty apparent that I cannot find the Md5 in the supplied wordlist, sorry."
            sys.exit(1)

Specify wordlist below, include extension please

Wordlist = “Wordlist.txt”

Thank you!

M = Main()
M.loadList()

Note: You can just enter a string directly into the M.removeMD5, remove the line below and just use M.removeMD5("").

toRem = raw_input("Please enter the Md5 you wish to reverse: ")

Note: You can just enter a string directly into the M.removeMD5, remove the line below and just use M.removeMD5("").

M.removeMD5(toRem)[/code]

Basically, for the people who cannot be arsed reading it through, what it does it searches through a wordlist you specify, when it matches a word from it with the cracked MD5 it returns a result.

Read full topic
